member.name: D3D10_SAMPLER_DESC.AddressU
member.summary: Method to use for resolving a u texture coordinate that is outside the 0 to 1 range (see ).

member.name: D3D10_SAMPLER_DESC.AddressV
member.summary: Method to use for resolving a v texture coordinate that is outside the 0 to 1 range.

member.name: D3D10_SAMPLER_DESC.AddressW
member.summary: Method to use for resolving a w texture coordinate that is outside the 0 to 1 range.

member.name: D3D10_SAMPLER_DESC.MipLODBias
member.summary: Offset from the calculated mipmap level. For example, if Direct3D calculates that a texture should be sampled at mipmap level 3 and MipLODBias is 2, then the texture will be sampled at mipmap level 5.

member.name: D3D10_SAMPLER_DESC.MaxAnisotropy
member.summary: Clamping value used if D3D10_FILTER_ANISOTROPIC or D3D10_FILTER_COMPARISON_ANISOTROPIC is specified in Filter. Valid values are between 1 and 16.

member.name: D3D10_SAMPLER_DESC.ComparisonFunc
member.summary: A function that compares sampled data against existing sampled data. The function options are listed in .

member.name: D3D10_SAMPLER_DESC.BorderColor
member.summary: Border color to use if D3D10_TEXTURE_ADDRESS_BORDER is specified for AddressU, AddressV, or AddressW. Range must be between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive.

member.name: D3D10_SAMPLER_DESC.MinLOD
member.summary: Lower end of the mipmap range to clamp access to, where 0 is the largest and most detailed mipmap level and any level higher than that is less detailed.

member.name: D3D10_SAMPLER_DESC.MaxLOD
member.summary: Upper end of the mipmap range to clamp access to, where 0 is the largest and most detailed mipmap level and any level higher than that is less detailed. This value must be greater than or equal to MinLOD. To have no upper limit on LOD set this to a large value such as D3D10_FLOAT32_MAX.
